title: Polish Language
banerDescription: Gain qualifications to teach Polish language in primary and secondary schools, developing your substantive and didactic competencies.
description:
• Teachers wishing to obtain qualifications to teach Polish language
  • Individuals interested in Polish literature and language culture
  • Specialists wanting to develop skills in analyzing and interpreting literary texts
description2: The studies aim to provide solid knowledge in grammar, history of the Polish language, literature, and practical teaching skills. The program covers both theory and practice, enabling participants to develop competencies necessary for a teacher's work.
description3: Through these studies, you will gain skills in analyzing and interpreting literature in the context of different epochs, as well as learn methods for effective teaching of the Polish language. Classes are conducted by experienced specialists, ensuring a high level of education.
description4: The study program emphasizes professional development, offering practical teaching classes and workshops. As a result, graduates are prepared to work in primary and secondary schools.

topics.title: Polish Language Culture with Practical Stylistics
Poetics and Analysis of Literary Works
Literature of Renaissance, Baroque, Enlightenment with Analysis of Literary Texts
Literature of Romanticism and Positivism with Analysis of Literary Texts
Literature of Young Poland and 20th Century, with Analysis of Literary Texts
Literary Text in School - Analysis and Interpretation
Causes and Prevention of Difficulties in Learning to Read and Write
Didactics of Teaching Polish Language in Primary School
Didactics of Teaching Polish Language in Secondary School

faculty: Classes are conducted by experienced specialists in the fields of linguistics, literary studies, and Polish language didactics.
practices:
• Pedagogical practice allows gaining experience in teaching Polish language.
  • Internships are carried out in primary and secondary schools.
evaluation: Assessment of learning outcomes includes activity during classes, completion of modules, implementation of internships, and preparation of a diploma thesis.
jobOpportunities:
Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:

  • Polish language teachers in primary and secondary schools
  • Specialists in literature analysis and interpretation
  • Educational consultants in the field of Polish language
  • Creators of didactic materials and educational programs
  • Employees of cultural and educational institutions
invite: Develop your literary passions and didactic competencies through our postgraduate studies in Polish language.
